meanings.definition: To clench or grind together, especially in anger or determination.
meanings.sent1: She gritted her teeth when facing a difficult challenge.
meanings.sent2: He gritted his jaw in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character gritted his teeth so hard, they made a squeaky noise.
meanings.sent4: The gears of the old machine gritted together, creating a loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The knight gritted his sword, ready for battle.

meanings.sent1: The path was gritted with small stones for better traction.
meanings.sent2: The gritted road made driving difficult.
meanings.sent3: The gritted surface of the playground prevented slipping.
meanings.sent4: Her shoes crunched on the gritted driveway.
meanings.sent5: The gritted sidewalk felt rough underfoot.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh scraping sound.
meanings.sent1: The chair gritted against the floor as she moved it.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate gritted loudly when opened.
meanings.sent3: The cat gritted its claws against the scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The car gritted to a stop on the gravel driveway.
meanings.sent5: The wind gritted through the branches of the trees.
